snippet: The city will pay $850,000 to settle a lawsuit stemming from the beating of an inmate at Rikers Island, a resolution similar to two other large settlements the city agreed to pay in June and July.
abstract: New York City agrees to pay $850,000 to settle a lawsuit stemming from the beating of an inmate at Rikers Island; resolution comes after the city agreed to pay other large settlements in similar cases that fit a rogue disciplinary pattern known as the Program, in which favored prisoners receive tacit approval to keep order by assaulting and threatening other inmates.
lead_paragraph: The city will pay $850,000 to settle a lawsuit stemming from the beating of an inmate at Rikers Island, a resolution similar to two other large settlements the city agreed to pay in June and July.

headline.seo: City to Pay Settlement in Another Prisoner Suit
headline.main: New York City to Pay in Another Prisoner Suit
headline.print_headline: New York City to Pay In Another Prisoner Suit
